Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Enhance OData deprecation error message" (#8242) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3428 There are two variants of error messages because the `/api/v1/Packages()` endpoint will be entirely disabled (it does not hijack at all) and will therefore need different wording than the rest of the endpoints which just have some sets of parameter combinations disabled. ### `/api/v1/Packages` - endpoint disabled ``` https://localhost/api/v1/Packages()?$orderby=Version ``` Response with formatting (my browser): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/95260367-6f376400-07dd-11eb-8ec3-e0b296a98fe4.png) Response without formatting (most likely experience): <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><m:error xmlns:m="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata"><m:code /><m:message xml:lang="en-US">This OData endpoint is disabled. Please refer to the following URL for more information about this deprecation: https://aka.ms/nuget/odata-deprecation</m:message></m:error> ### All other non-hijacked queries - combinations of parameters disabled ``` https://localhost/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id=%27Newtonsoft.Json%27&$orderby=Version ``` Response with formatting: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/95260626-ea007f00-07dd-11eb-857e-f93351bb923a.png) Response without formatting (most likely experience): <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><m:error xmlns:m="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata"><m:code /><m:message xml:lang="en-US">The combination of parameters provided to this OData endpoint is not supported. Please refer to the following URL for more information about this deprecation: https://aka.ms/nuget/odata-deprecation</m:message></m:error> ### Notes - I could not find a good way to pretty format the XML with indentation or whitespace - The link currently points to the root blog URL but will be fixed up to point to a real blog post/doc prior to the feature flags being used.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2020.10.05]RI of dev into master" (#8239) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Making Restore for Older TFMs with TargetPlatformStrings" (#10113) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget Restore started supporting net5.0-* TargetFrameworks, but it treat all the other older targetframeworks as  if there were without targetPlatform. 
eg restore works perfectly for this project
```csproj
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFrameworks>net5.0;net5.0-Windows</TargetFrameworks>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
but the restore on the following project 
```csproj
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp3.1;netcoreapp3.1-Windows</TargetFrameworks> -->
  </PropertyGroup>  
</Project>
```
results in 
```
NuGet.targets(130,5): error : Invalid restore input. Duplicate frameworks found: 'netcoreapp3.1, netcoreapp3.1'
```

##usage

We have using targetPlatforms in the runtime repo for a while now. This will help us in using the latest sdk and nuget feaures.
Currently the restore does not work in the VS for projects, it will help us rectify that as well.


cc @ericstj @ViktorHofer @safern

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[CPVM - PMUI] Error on the Browse tab for non-CPS projects" (#10089) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
Error on "Browse" tab in the PMUI for a non-CPS project CPVM enabled.  

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Download the attached file

2. Open the project in VisualStudio (Visual Studio version used: Version 16.8.0 Preview 4.0 [30518.12.main])

3. Build 

4. Open "Manage NuGet Packages For Solution" and Browse tab

Result :
Error:
Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: versionRange
Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: versionRange

[Repo.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5300957/Repo.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PM UI:  selecting projects in a solution-level context is slow" (#10112) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Repro steps:
1.  Open the NuGet.Client solution (https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client).
2.  In Solution Explorer right-click on the solution and select "Manage NuGet Packages for Solution..."
3.  In PM UI switch to the Browse tab.
4   Select a package.
5.  In the right-hand details pane check the checkbox for all projects.

Expected result:  The action will complete nearly instantaneously.
Actual result:  The action takes ~2 seconds to complete in 16.8.  In 16.7 (and the release-5.6.x branch instead of dev) it's nearly instantaneous.

This appears to be the result of heavy asyncification with JTF.

This is partially affected by https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10094.

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.VisualStudio.Internal.Contracts should use PublicAPIAnalyzers" (#10111) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: `NuGet.VisualStudio.Internal.Contracts` is not packed into a nupkg, and is entirely for NuGet's own internal use. However, it defines the over-the-wire contracts for Code Spaces (and Live Share?) scenarios. Therefore, backwards compatibility is still very important. Hence we should use PublicApiAnalyzers to minimise the risk that someone accidentally adds a breaking change.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget Debug verbosity should say where a package came from" (#3055) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
For debug purposes, it would be really useful if `restore -v Debug` said where a package came from. 

Useful information for a package that would be nice to have:
- whether it came from a local cache or server and the actual package path in either case
- the address of the feed it used for that package
- which Nuget.configs it took into consideration

Please read the following information before posting the issue.
https://openbullet.store
[openbullet](https://openbullet.store)
[openbullet download](https://openbullet.store)
[download openbullet](https://openbullet.store)
## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.
